criteria: Understanding of the Transition to an Agricultural Economy
Analysis of Social and Economic Impact
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of the hunter-gatherer economy of pre-Columbian California.
Shows minimal understanding of the hunter-gatherer economy with significant inaccuracies.
Displays a basic understanding of the hunter-gatherer economy with some inaccuracies.
Exhibits a satisfactory understanding of the hunter-gatherer economy with minor inaccuracies.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of the hunter-gatherer economy with few inaccuracies.
Shows a comprehensive and accurate understanding of the hunter-gatherer economy of pre-Columbian California.
Demonstrates no understanding of the Franciscans' role in altering California's economy.
Shows minimal knowledge of the Franciscans' influence with major misconceptions.
Displays a basic awareness of the Franciscans' role with several inaccuracies.
Exhibits a satisfactory understanding of the Franciscans' influence with minor inaccuracies.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of the Franciscans' role with few inaccuracies.
Shows a comprehensive and accurate understanding of the Franciscans' role in transforming California's economy.
Demonstrates no understanding of how the Franciscans introduced and developed an agricultural economy.
Shows minimal understanding of the transition, with significant misconceptions about agricultural practices.
Displays a basic understanding of the shift to agriculture with several inaccuracies.
Exhibits a satisfactory understanding of the transition with minor inaccuracies.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of how the Franciscans established and expanded agriculture.
Shows a comprehensive and accurate understanding of the economic shift from hunter-gatherer to agricultural practices under Franciscan influence.
Provides no analysis of the broader social and economic impact of this transition.
Offers a minimal and superficial analysis with significant misunderstandings.
Presents a basic analysis with several inaccuracies and omissions.
Provides a satisfactory analysis with minor inaccuracies.
Demonstrates a strong analysis of the social and economic consequences of the economic shift.

Shows a comprehensive and insightful analysis of the social and economic impacts of the transition from a hunter-gatherer to an agricultural economy, including impacts on indigenous populations and the environment.
